runs.comm: Gilchrist off the mark with a cover-driven single. He says he'll knuckle down tonight
popped up on off, nipped across the right hander, who defends on the back foot
away with a flap off the front foot off a leg-side delivery, swiped round through square
headrush outside off, Gilchrist playing and missing a wide one
stroked through the covers, glorious shot on the top of the bounce
good swing away from the left hander, driven back to the bowler
terrific start from Sreesanth, yorking Clarke who played for the outswinger but was beaten for pace outside off
a good follow up, the ball jarring the bottom hand as it crashed into the splice, defended down in line with off
up there on off, worked back to the bowler who bristles with attitude, thinking of shying down the sticks
bangs in short, fended to mid-on and that would have been out if Gambhir had hit from close in but it missed by a good metre or so
turned to the legs this time
overpitched, driven out through the covers where it's well chased down
a good stop at extra cover
a touch of width, worked on the up through deep point, with a misdirected drive. He hit that hard all the same
a bye called for one which perhaps hit the inside edge, Dhoni diving wide to his right and the ball popping off his glove
a stolen single to mid-off
wide outside off, driven hard to cover where Harbhajan stops it well and is naturally booed for his efforts
on off, and oh hello, that's a lovely piece of timing as Gilchrist stands and delivers the sweetest drive through mid-on. He made that look too easy
driven out to mid-on
pushed off the hips to deep square leg for an easy three
a huge outside edge as Gilchrist tries to drive out over covers and the ball goes aerial, landing just short of third man
short and cut down behind point
defended on the back foot down to third man
bouncer this time
defended on the front foot
defended on the front foot
short ball moving away from the left-hander outside off, cut high through the gully region
over the wicket, defended on the back foot
driven into the off-side ring where it's cut off at cover

outside off, cut into the covers and Gilchrist nearly puts his fellow batsman in danger with a late call of "No!" ... as he was talking to Nine. That would have been an interesting, not to say rare, dismissal
another good delivery, on off, shaped to pull from outside off to midwicket
on the legs, clipped high and aerially in front of midwivket, chased down just inside the rope
crashes into leg and turned round through the 45
outside off, waits for one he thinks will cut in, it doesn't and although his feet are still trapped in the crease he picks the slower ball, gets over it, and crashes hard through point
shot and a half, the first six of the night, Clarke stepping down and driving well over long-on
keeps low, crashing in on the legs, but would have gone down, Clarke getting rapped and missing out
across the left hander, stays over, pushed to mid-off
an inside edge is turned round through fine
outside off, cut down through third man
a misfield that's so bad it's hilarious, Harbhajan and Pathan both chasing after it and both trying to take it over their heads
worked into the leg side
defended on the front foot
slow yorker, well dug out on the toes in front of off
outside off and Gilchrist booms that through fine leg with a huge hook which came right of the middle and flew five rows back
he goes for the big one again, holing out at long-on, and is well caught, low in front
off the mark with a push to the covers
that one dies in the pitch as it sits up outside off and is driven hard through the covers
the pitch is really slowing up now indeed, that one barely getting up as the batsman gets on the back foot and has to stab down at the last second
starts well, a touch of turn, and cramping Clarke, who defends forward, for room
squares up to that one, plays on the front foot, the edge skewing tamely out to point
well bowled, following him on leg, driven out to mid-on
a wild throw from Karthik this time
a touch of air, straight, and swept in front of square
right up there on middle, defended on the front foot
in straight, driven back hard to the bowler, a bump-ball flying up and taken on the bounce
on leg, swivelled round behind square this time
on leg, pushed back down into the track
turned off the legs in front of square now
a nibble-and-run, pushed down in front and they set off immediately
another push-and-go takes Australia closer to victory
on leg, pushed to mid-on, no chance of a single
jogged a single out to long-on this time
bent down leg, driven back out to mid-on
wide down leg, Clarke helps it on its way... all the way to the fielder at square
on leg, driven out to midwicket, still no run there
finds the gap between square and midwicket this time with a push off the front foot to take the strike again
short ball, bouncer angling in at the right hander, who defends back down, looks for the run, and calls "No!"
another dot ball, straight, defended back down
and a wide finishes the job
